answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found a number of sample ethics policies and public official orientation documents which cover reimbursement.
The City of Bothell, WA has details on page 30 of their public official orientation document about the reimbursement of travel expenses.
http://www.mrsc.org/policyprocedures/B67ccprotocol.pdf
On page 26 of the ICMA sample orientation packet it describes what could go in a reimbursement section.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/302602
The City of Mesa, AZ has information about reimbursements on page 12 of their Ethics Handbook.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/1829
The Ethics Ordinance from St. Mary's County, MD has a similar section on page 6.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/7109
The Institute for Local Government has a lot of information on reimbursement policies for elected officials. 
http://www.ca-ilg.org/reimbursementpolicies
You can view their sample policy below.
http://www.ca-ilg.org/sites/ilgbackup.org/files/resources/Sample_Reimbursement_Policy_1_06_1.pdf
I also included an article from California about conflict of interest laws which has a section dedicated to reimbursement policies.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/3833
I hope these help!
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Tyler Burkart
text:
The City of Janesville is receiving some interest from our elected officials to look into the possibility of drafting a reimbursement policy for city council members. I was curious if any municipalities would be willing to share their policies with the City of Janesville, which includes a list of the specific items that the city can reimburse elected officials for. 
Please email your responses to burkartt@ci.janesville.wi.us. Thank you for your help.
title: City Council Reimbursement Policy
